dc:title: On Pilgrimage - March 1957
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: A detailed account of her attendance as an observer at the Communist Party Convention. She identifies with their ends--a just social order--but not their means or beliefs (violence and atheism). Prods Catholics to "hard study" of those working for peace and justice, learning with her "of incorporating social thinking into the works of mercy." Keywords: prison
